host.name: CQLSH_HOST
host.description: The host of the Cassandra cluster

username.name: CQLSH_USER
username.description: The user can connect in the Cassandra cluster.

password.name: CQLSH_PASSWD
password.description: The password to connect in the Cassandra cluster.

connections.name: Apache Cassandra
connections.description: Execute queries to a Cassandra cluster with [cqlsh](https://cassandra.apache.org/doc/latest/cassandra/tools/cqlsh.html).

overview.description: Apache Cassandra is a highly scalable, distributed NoSQL database designed to handle large amounts of data across many commodity servers.
features: Fault-tolerant with no single point of failure
Support for structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data

connections.name: AWS CLI

requirements.description: Use an IAM credential with reduced scope to only create secrets and/or listing ECS services.

connections.description: Hoop can be configured to use the AWS command line to manage resources in multiple accounts.

overview.description: The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool to manage your AWS services from the command line.

connections.name: AWS CloudWatch
connections.description: CloudWatch in Hoop simplifies AWS log analysis by providing direct access to log groups with automatic environment variable setup and an optimized interface for log exploration.

requirements.description: The AWS credentials require the minimal set of IAM permissions to work:

aws_access_key_id.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
aws_access_key_id.description: The AWS access key ID for CloudWatch Logs accesss

aws_secret_access_key.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
aws_secret_access_key.description: The AWS secret access key for CloudWatch Logs access

aws_region.name: AWS_REGION
aws_region.description: The AWS region where your CloudWatch log groups are located (e.g., us-east-1, eu-west-1)

connections.name: AWS ECS
connections.description: Interact with Elastic Container Service, executing one-off sessions into ECS tasks/containers.

requirements.description: This connection uses a wrapper script available in the hoophq/hoopdev image called ecs-exec.sh. This script requires the following permissions to work:

cluster_name.name: CLUSTER_NAME
cluster_name.description: The name or arn of the ECS Cluster

service_name.name: SERVICE_NAME
service_name.description: The name of the service on ECS

container.name: CONTAINER
container.description: The name of the container defaults to the first one.

connections.name: BigQuery
connections.description: Execute queries to Big Query with the [bq command line tool](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/bq-command-line-tool).

requirements.description: The Google Service Account Credentials must have the following permissions:

overview.description: Google BigQuery is a fully managed, serverless data warehouse that enables super-fast SQL queries using the processing power of Google's infrastructure.
features: Serverless and fully managed data warehouse
useCases: Machine learning model training on big data

requirements: BigQuery API enabled in your GCP project

advancedConfiguration.connectionString: bq command-line tool with service account
featureConfiguration: IAM roles and permissions for BigQuery access
otherRequirements: Data modeling for optimal query performance
Monitoring with Cloud Logging and Monitoring

google_application_credentials.name: GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS
google_application_credentials.description: The service account credentials file in JSON format

cloudsdk_core_project.name: CLOUDSDK_CORE_PROJECT
cloudsdk_core_project.description: The project id to use for request

cloudsdk_python.name: CLOUDSDK_PYTHON
cloudsdk_python.description: The path of python interpreter, defaults to /usr/bin/python3.9

connections.name: Clojure
connections.description: Dynamic functional programming language for the JVM

overview.description: Clojure is a dynamic, general-purpose programming language that combines the approachability and interactive development of a scripting language with an efficient and robust infrastructure for multithreaded programming.
useCases: Web development with Ring and Compojure

connections.name: Django
connections.description: Interact with the Artisan console or execute ad-hoc scripts.

overview.description: Django is a high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design with built-in administrative interface.
features: Powerful admin interface for content management

connections.name: DynamoDB
connections.description: DynamoDB in Hoop offers a unique experience where tables are treated as databases, with automatic environment variable configuration and an interface optimized for NoSQL.

requirements.description: The AWS credentials require the minimal set of IAM permissions to work

overview.description: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability.

requirements: IAM user with appropriate DynamoDB permissions
AWS Access Key ID and Secret Access Key
Network connectivity to AWS DynamoDB endpoints

featureConfiguration: IAM roles and policies for fine-grained access

aws_access_key_id.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
aws_access_key_id.description: The AWS access key ID for DynamoDB access

aws_secret_access_key.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
aws_secret_access_key.description: The AWS secret access key for DynamoDB access

aws_region.name: AWS_REGION
aws_region.description: The AWS region where your DynamoDB tables are located (e.g., us-east-1, eu-west-1)

connections.name: Elixir IEx
connections.description: Interact with the IEx console or execute ad-hoc scripts.

overview.description: Elixir is a dynamic, functional language designed for building maintainable and scalable applications, running on the Erlang Virtual Machine.

connections.name: Jump Hosts
connections.description: Hoop could act as a bastion server allowing the execution of one-off sessions.

kubeconfig.name: KUBECONFIG
kubeconfig.description: A [Kubeconfig File](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/organize-cluster-access-kubeconfig/) with permission to access the cluster

connections.name: Kubernetes
connections.description: Hoop.dev can be configured to use the kubectl command line to manage resources and execute actions on workloads in Kubernetes.

overview.description: Kubernetes is an open-source container orchestration platform that automates the deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

requirements: Valid kubeconfig file with cluster credentials
Network connectivity to Kubernetes API server

otherRequirements: Understanding of Kubernetes resources and manifests

connections.name: Microsoft SQL Server
connections.description: Connecting to Microsoft SQL Server can be done natively using an IDE or any supported client library. Alternatively, you can use the [sqlcmd command line utility](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/tools/sqlcmd/sqlcmd-utility) for one-off executions.

overview.description: Microsoft SQL Server is a relational database management system developed by Microsoft, offering comprehensive data management and business intelligence capabilities.
features: Advanced security with Always Encrypted technology
Built-in machine learning and AI capabilities

requirements: SQL Server authentication or Windows authentication

featureConfiguration: Always On Availability Groups for high availability
otherRequirements: SQL Server Agent for automated tasks

host.name: HOST
host.description: The IP or Host of the SQL Server

user.name: USER
user.description: The user with access to the instance

pass.name: PASS
pass.description: The password with access to the instance

port.name: PORT
port.description: The port of the SQL server

db.name: DB
db.description: The name of the database to connect (Required when using the connection via the command line).

insecure.name: INSECURE
insecure.description: If the connection will ignore the chain of certificates presented by the server. The connection will be subject to man-in-the-middle attacks if the network is not reliable. By default, this option is set to false.

connections.name: MongoDB
connections.description: A MongoDB connection is a native type, allowing for the auditing of queries and redaction of their output. It facilitates a local TCP connection without requiring a password.

overview.description: MongoDB is a NoSQL document-oriented database that provides high scalability and flexibility for modern applications.
features: Flexible schema for rapid data evolution
useCases: Web and mobile applications with variable data

featureConfiguration: Replica set configuration for high availability

connectionString.name: CONNECTION_STRING
connectionString.description: The MongoDB connection string. See [MongoDB connection string](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/connection-string/) for more details about the proper format.

connections.name: MySQL
connections.description: Connect to a private mysql instance from your favorite IDE

overview.description: MySQL is the world's most popular open-source relational database, offering proven performance, reliability, and ease-of-use.
features: High performance with optimized storage engines

host.name: HOST
host.description: The IP or Host of the MySQL server

user.name: USER
user.description: The user to connect in the MySQL server

pass.name: PASS
pass.description: The password to connect to the MySQL server

port.name: PORT
port.description: The port of the MySQL server

db.name: DB
db.description: The name of the database to connect (Required when using the connection via the command line).

preSQLScriptFile.name: PRE_SQL_SCRIPT_FILE
preSQLScriptFile.description: Append a custom SQL script at the beginning of the execution.

connections.name: Node.js
connections.description: JavaScript runtime environment for server-side development

overview.description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine, enabling server-side JavaScript development with high performance and scalability.

featureConfiguration: Process management with PM2 or similar

connections.name: Oracle
connections.description: Execute queries to Oracle instances with [sqlcl](https://www.oracle.com/database/sqldeveloper/technologies/sqlcl/).

overview.description: Oracle Database is a multi-model database management system produced by Oracle Corporation, designed for enterprise grid computing and high-performance applications.
features: Advanced security with data encryption and masking

requirements: Oracle user account with appropriate privileges

host.name: HOST
host.description: The IP or Host of the Oracle server

user.name: USER
user.description: The user to connect in the Oracle server

pass.name: PASS
pass.description: The password to connect to the Oracle server. Make sure to URL encode the password if it contains any special characters.

port.name: PORT
port.description: The port of the Oracle server

sid.name: SID
sid.description: The service name or SID (System identifier) to identify the database service.

connections.name: PHP Artisan
connections.description: Interact with the Laravel Artisan console or execute ad-hoc PHP scripts.

overview.description: Laravel Artisan is the command-line interface included with Laravel, providing helpful commands for application development.

connections.name: PostgreSQL
connections.description: A Postgres connection is a native type, allowing for the auditing of queries and redaction of their output. It facilitates a local TCP connection without requiring a password.

overview.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source object-relational database system with a strong reputation for reliability, feature robustness, and performance.
features: Advanced SQL compliance with custom data types
Extensible with custom functions and operators
useCases: Complex web applications with advanced queries

host.name: HOST
host.description: The IP or hostname of the PostgreSQL server

user.name: USER
user.description: The username to connect to PostgreSQL

pass.name: PASS
pass.description: The password to connect to the Postgres server. Make sure to URL encode the password if it contains any special characters.

port.name: PORT
port.description: The port of the Postgres server

db.name: DB
db.description: The name of the database to connect (Required when using the connection via the command line).

sslmode.name: SSLMODE
sslmode.description: How to connect via tls with the remote host, it defaults to prefer. See [PostgreSQL SSL documentation](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-ssl.html#LIBPQ-SSL-PROTECTION) for more information. Available options are: disable, prefer, require, and verify-full

connections.name: Python Scripts
connections.description: Execute Python scripts and interact with the Python interpreter for development and automation tasks.

overview.description: Python is a versatile, high-level programming language perfect for scripting, automation, data analysis, and application development.

connections.name: Redis
connections.description: Execute queries to Redis with the redis-cli command line tool.

overview.description: Redis is an in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache, and message broker with support for various data structures.
features: Support for strings, hashes, lists, sets, and more

requirements: Authentication credentials if AUTH is enabled

otherRequirements: Memory allocation planning for dataset size

connections.name: Ruby on Rails
connections.description: Interact with the rails console or execute ad-hoc scripts in a Ruby On Rails application.

overview.description: Ruby on Rails is a web application framework written in Ruby that follows the model-view-controller (MVC) architectural pattern, providing tools for rapid web development.
features: Active Record ORM for database interactions
Rich ecosystem of gems and plugins

host.name: HOST
host.description: The IP or hostname of the SSH server

port.name: PORT
port.description: The port of the SSH server, default to 22

user.name: USER
user.description: The username of the Linux server

pass.name: PASS
pass.description: The credentials of the username if password authentication is enabled in the SSH server.

authorized_server_keys.name: AUTHORIZED_SERVER_KEYS
authorized_server_keys.description: The private key of the user that corresponds to the public key at $HOME/<user>/.ssh/authorized_keys

connections.name: Secure Shell (SSH)
connections.description: Proxy an SSH Server to remote hosts in your private network.

overview.description: SSH (Secure Shell) is a cryptographic network protocol for operating network services securely over an unsecured network, commonly used for remote command-line login and remote command execution.
features: Encrypted communication for secure remote access
Public key authentication for enhanced security

requirements: SSH server running on target host

connections.name: Web Applications and APIs
connections.description: Interact with web applications and APIs tunneling through hoop.dev.

host.name: HOST
host.description: The IP or hostname of the service
